company

Class Company

  • java.lang.Object
    • company.Company

  • public class Company
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is responsible for data entry and handling all Company-related logic. Course Name: CST8284 Object Oriented Programming (Computer Programmer). Student name: Anton Hrytsyk. Student number: 040938383 Professor Jason M Assignment title: Company Management Tool Prototype. Assignment due date: Sunday April 14, 2019 by 11:59.

    Version:
    Assignment 3 Company class.
    Author:
    Anton Hrytsyk

      • isMaximumEmployees

        public boolean isMaximumEmployees()
        This method serves as a getter for isMaximumEmployees. This method is used throughout the program to determine whether new employees can be added.
        Returns:
        value of isMaxEmployees.

        Returns:

      • getCurrentEmployeeIndex

        public int getCurrentEmployeeIndex()
        This method is an accessor of the currentEmployee.
        Returns:

      • setCurrentEmployee

        public boolean setCurrentEmployee(int currentEmployee)
        This method is a mutator of the currentEmployee. Changes currentEmployee to the specified value. User is unable to set the value grater than or equals to the size of the array.
        Parameters:
        currentEmployee - - new value of currentEmployee.
        Returns:
        true if the value was successfully changed.

      • getCurrentEmployee

        public Employee getCurrentEmployee()
        Accessor to the current employee
        Returns:
        returns employee at the index pointed by currentEmployee

      • findSeniorEmployee

        public Employee findSeniorEmployee()
        This method is responsible for determining the senior Employee. Searches for employee with the earliest start date. Uses Calendar.before() to compare start dates.
        Returns:
        employee with the earliest startDate. null if no employees are available.

      • addEmployee

        public Employee addEmployee(java.lang.String name,
                            int employeeNumber,
                            OurDate date,
                            double salary,
                            int type)
                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        This method returns the employee that will be added to the System. Based on user's choice one of the three subclasses will be instantiated. The object will be initialized with the base constructor in the subclass.

        Handles OutOfMemoryError with setting the value of isMaxEmployee to true, and therefore preventing further addition of new employees.

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the employee.
        employeeNumber - employee number.
        date - hiring date.
        salary - employee salary.
        type - employee type - this parameter will determine the object of which class will be created.
        Returns:
        Object created from one of the Employee's subclasses. This object will later be added to the arrayList. Returns null if OutOfMemory was thrown.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • findEmployee

        public Employee findEmployee(int empNum)
        This method is responsible for finding employees( if exist).
        Parameters:
        empNum - employee number.
        Returns:
        employee whose employee number matches the parameter. if employee does't exist - returns null.

      • deleteEmployee

        public Employee deleteEmployee(int empNum)
        This method is responsible for deleting employees( if exist). Only deletes the first employee that was found with the matching employee number. Uses findEmployee to find and determine if employee with the specified parameter exists.
        Parameters:
        empNum - employee number.
        Returns:
        Employee that will be deleted from the arrayList. if employee wasn't found - returns null.

      • saveEmployeesToFile

        public void saveEmployeesToFile()
        This method is responsible for Employee object serialization. Employee Objects are being save to a file in binary. File name: CurrentEmployees.emp Employees are loaded using FileOutputStream fOut = new FileOutputStream(employeeFile); ObjectOutputStream objOut = new ObjectOutputStream(fOut); If file doesn't exit it will be created.

      • loadEmployeesFromFile

        public void loadEmployeesFromFile()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        This method is responsible for loading employees from the file. Initiates employee deserialization, employee objects are being loaded into the employees ArrayList. Employees are loaded using FileInputStream fIn = new FileInputStream(employeeFile); ObjectInputStream objIn = new ObjectInputStream(fIn); If EOFException was thrown - all employees were successfully loaded. Handles FileNotFoundException by trying to create the file recursively. Handles classNotFound exception by printing out stacktrace. if the file doesn't exist it will be created. If for any reason cannot create a file - new ConsoleException is thrown.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if IO operation was somehow interrupted.
